name: Among Ripples
description: Control a pond's ecosystem; experiment with what you can do and see what happens. Among Ripples is a meditative ecosystem management simulator; you add different creatures to the pond and see how they interact.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista SP1 or newer Processor: 1.6 Ghz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB graphics memory and Shader Model 2.0 compatible DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 250 MB available space

reviews.review_text: It's not really worth writing an entire review about Among Ripples so here we go:  Pros: +Good looking watercoloured background. +Music +Atmosphere +Price  Cons: -Not sure if there is a goal or a failure state. -Didn't 'grab' me. -Mouse and keyboard support? It was really weird.  Final verdict: Try it out, see if you like it. If not, it only takes a few minutes to download and only a few seconds to uninstall. It's a good screensaver I guess.
I'm opening this for the next kid I babysit.

This game is one which initially appears as if it will be a moving art piece with little enjoyment to be had, yet five minutes in i realised the true beauty of the game was completely understated in the reviews which i had read. The art style is mesmerising, the soundrtrack is tranquil and by jove the gameplay is minimal, yet interesting.  For a free game, download the bugger now!

Boring... Kind of fun for the first few seconds, but later it just turns into clicking on GIFs of seaweed to make more fish. Just watch some fish swim around in a pond instead of playing this, and you will be more satisfied. At least it's F2P.
A decent game for just messing around mindlessly, but it didn't seem to go much deeper than that.
very relaxing to be honest, i enjoyed sitting back and not having a task to do and i guess the only 'task' is just sit back and click the things that you can click :3

There's very little interface for this game. Basically purple gunk fills up the bottom if you don't have a stable system. Keeping the purple gunk down it boring so I ended up sending wave after wave of pike to their deaths. Apparently when introduced to an inhospitable environment pike will shrink to about a third of their size, then abruptly explode.  I did not know that before. Sorry for spoilers.

When you feel depressed and you want to see ripples, don't play this game. There is no ripple physics engine and no free hugs, so if you are depressed, go find a country where prostitution is legal. That is all...
Very boring. The tutorial is basically the whole game, and its more so a screensaver then a game.
Neat school project, but not fun to play as a 'game'

Among Ripples is an amazing game! You control a water economy, letting it thrive or crash and burn. The graphics are amazing and the music fits the game very well. The only problem is that there is not enough gameplay, it ends very quickly. I recommend this game to people who appreciate games for the content, not the length. Rating: 8/10

If you've had a long, stressful day of life and need something to help you relax, then this is the game for you. Sit back and enjoy the ability to create and observe a small ecosystem in your own little pond, then stand by helplessly as it all inevitably collapses as your fish die from lack of oxygen or get eaten by bigger creatures. All while a beautiful soundtrack plays in the background.
Sort of nice and relaxing for a bit. But after 5 minutes it gets boring and reptitive. Not much like a real ecosystem.  3/10

This game would be better if it told you what animals did what.  You basically have to assume what everyone does.   I think it has potential.  Like they could turn it into an educational game for kids.  If they took the time to add in all of the information it's lacking.  I played it thinking I might feel relaxed after,  instead it just made me frustrated with the lack in information.  So it just made me really irritated.   I do not recommend this game for anyone who likes to learn in games like this, or anyone who gets irritated when they don’t know what they are doing.
I would rather leave my room and go stare at my fishtank.
Nearly cried when the big black reptile walked out of the pool :(
Bit of a boring game. When you have spent 10 minutes playing it and get bored, you'll have the relaxing music there to send you off to sleep. Recommended for the music only.

Even for a free game, this was quite... lacking. The tutorial had about 3 different things you could do, and that pretty much covered the entire game. I usually quite like 'meditative' games, but this just seemed plain dull.
all you had to do is follow the damn train CJ
Meaning of peaceful life... in this game.

Ive give the game 7/10, the make lets you make a pond ecosystem and control the amount of fish. You can control how much oxygen there is i the pond. If you want to play something to past time or you dont have anything to play, this is a good game to play.
frequent over population.   10/10 would kill again.

This is a relaxing game that gets a tad boring after 10 minutes. I love the music and the simple graphics, but the gameplay needs a little more. A progress bar, fish health/age status... anything! I would be super excited to see this game add more features. Overall, I enjoyed it for the 10 minutes I played it.

Pros: +deep and unpredictable AI, every runthrough is different +NPC animations are insanely realistic +extremely immersive experience +mesmorizing graphics +entrancing soundtrack  Cons: -algae is overpowered, grows no matter what I try to do
I don't know what I did. But my otter turned blue.
No real gameplay to it.
Now I'm craving lobsters, even though because of this game I know they feed on fish corpses..
It's very very relaxed
I cried for twenty minutes when the otter ate my first and most prolific pike would maybe play again if my tears weren't blocking my vision
just peace :) we need more games like this
Da ♥♥♥, this game is soo dead... chill you spawn fish they die you spawn another one game done.
I think the fish eat eachother but I wasnt really paying attention  probably not  this game is worth exactly what I paid for it
Hope your PC is top shelf because this game takes quad SLI and over 9000 clocks of boostage to run  cool game for kids to explore ecosystems. Fun for all of 20 mins
Nothing much but good ^^ could use some improvements tho.

Ive give the game 7/10, the make lets you make a pond ecosystem and control the amount of fish. You can control how much oxygen there is i the pond. If you want to play something to past time or you dont have anything to play, this is a good game to play.
frequent over population.   10/10 would kill again.

I find that this game is calming, but if you are not in the mood for a virtually pointless game about about a small ecosystem where you can spawn crawfish-then this game is boring. It is, however, free, so I can't say I wasted time or money with this little 'game.'
Yay, a Fish Pond.
Imho there isn't enough content in this to call it a game. (Got bored of it in about 3 minutes, even though I love 'walking simulators' and such.)
Great! and the music Bravo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
nice looking but not much to do

'Among Ripples is a meditative ecosystem management simulator.' On a very small scale: one screen, one pond, no numbers, 6 species, and besides spawning a small number of these, you can control the oxygen level.  I want this on mobile to play with on breaks.
Call of Driftfish: Pond Warfare
This game is good for STRESS!
This is a pretty relaxing game...

I thought this could be a cool innovative little game, unfortunately I was right. After a laggy tutorial I went on to try the normal play, I spawned two beavers and it brought my computer to a crashing halt .. . gg beavers.  i7 8gb ram 3 gb video 1 terabyte hd windows 7 etc
Everything died. THE FREAKING END

I'm sorry for downvoting this, but this is in my opinion a waste of time. First off, it doesn't give you a goal. I can forgive that seeing as the player is probably aware that a game that advertises itself as simulation might not have that. But the interface is horrible. I do not know what's supposed to be a polluted or healthy lake, I don't know whether my fish are doing well or not. I need feedback from the game to know what is going on, otherwise i'm just clicking buttons with no idea whether it's working or not.  Free to play is about the only positive thing I have to say about this.
worse than absent you litteraly just watch

I have to say i was skeptical when i first installed this game but it has exceeded my expectations and now it is one of my favorite games i have ever played. I have played lass than 10 minutes and my lobster are already 700 years huge and im making them bigger. Everyone has t download this game immediately. I especially like this game while doing my homework . It is a masterpiece because it captures Nature's peacefulness in one single videogame, which i might add it only takes 10 seconds to download. 10/10 would download 1000X again.
realy boring, looks awesome
This game is terrible.  You spawn about 3 types of sea creatures and they fight.  I really dont understand the point in this game.

This could have been interesting. It's not. It needs more to do. The few options  that's available isn't enough. A bit more on the grapics would be nice too, maybe some kind of animation in the water (bubbles are standing still? lol).  I DID like how the seasons changed in the background. Nice touch.  Finishing words: Lucky it was free.
bored in the first 3 minutes
I thought it said Among Nipples.
My fish died. -13/10
Ok, not really a game. More of an experiment, fun for 5 minutes.
200 MB really? its a flash game... what are you hiding in there, a porno?
Not a deep game. You can only spawn animals, an action that doesn't really do much to affect the biosphere. So...cute game, good idea, but bad output. Not worth putting money out for.

Kinda cute, but not that cool. I understand the concept, but to be more sneakily educative, it would need a bit more. Will be interesting if this turns out cool or boring at the end once it's finished. So far, recommended.
This is a game about making your own pond. ...That's it.
The graphics are good and the otter is adorable but it gets boring after about 5 mins or less, but i guess i can't complain because it's free (well i can complain about it because i just did)
This is not a game. Fun for 2-5 minutes.
everything got sick and died
Played it for ten minutes, I was bored.

I hate to leave a negative review for a game that isn't necessarily bad but here we are. I spend my first 10 minutes figuring out the game and trying to carefully balance the yellow cloud and rising blue bar and I feel like I figured out a pretty good system that kept the lake happy.  I then spent the next 10 minutes clicking everything as quickly as possible and I did even better at the game. I feel like I wasted my time.  Aside from the gameplay there doesn't seem to be any options once you're actually in the lake. Pressing escape and every other button on my keyboard didn't do anything. Maybe I missed it but a menu would be nice. I alt F4d and now I'm going to uninstall it

Some say, this is not a game, It is my opinion it is a game. This is a very relaxing game, for people who want a game for resting between the gridding of other games. If you got small kids they will love it. This is a very happy game and I say that with a smile. My dog even like it on the big screen. I think, cats would like this game, as well. For this kind of game, I feel it's not a waste of money or time.
Overall it was just boring, was expecting it to be a lot different.
Just a pond simulator, very relaxing. Don't expect anything more than that, and you'll enjoy it.
Really boring and laggy.
Great little game, it's free and might teach people something.
Beautiful,would recomend to anyone who wants to sit back and have a good time 10/10.
A nice, relaxing game. A good addition could be a way to control the weather (rain, heat ect).
Great way to kill time, I really enjoyed it.
I smell potential. This game isn't much now but i do thing there's a lot of room for improvement, while still keeping the games simplistic gameplay.
cool game.

I really enjoyed playing this with my 3 year old son. It meant we could talk about eco-systems on a very basic level that he could understand - even if he did have a bit of an obsession with adding pike that did make it a little difficult. It's easy enough for him to control too and the graphics and background music are very relaxed and soothing. Great for a free game.
Great game for those with anxiety. It's very calming to just listen to the music and watch the fish as they swim around. It's slow-paced and overall extremely relaxing!
Nice, more of a simulation then a game. I like playing it when a specific game gets too intense, since this has a very calm atmosphere.
Its a cool concept but it gets very boring after a while. And dont judge do to my play time because only needed five min to figure out what this game was.
boring.. thats it summonning fishes they grow/die, summonning more.
Great Soundtrack. Relaxing and wonderful. Good experience.

Even though I have only played about twenty-five minutes of this; the only reason I think someone would play this game would be because they needed to kill some time before doing something they have planned; but even then there are countless things that would be a little more intresting to kill time with than this game. I say all this becuase in the twenty-five minutes I feel like I have done all there is to do.
Manage your aquarium/lake with minor complexity. Relaxing music and easy to enjoy fish spawn.
wasnt bad but very basic

I... I have know idea why this is so entertaining. My favorite thing to do is make a flourishing pond and then just watch it deteriorate. I sit there for so long and just watch things happen. I don't really get it, but I can't stop.

Why I chose to play this game? Simple: To create the process of eutrophication in a simple lake such as this one. But due to the lack of complexity of this game to change ph levels and to further change O2 levels, I can partially enhance the growth of algea in the lake to sort of begin the process of eutrophication. Overall I was unpleased, but I can't say I hate this game. It's too casual, and I should have known better. This game does have potential, just needs more added features to it. Look up eutrophication for those who didn't take an Environmental science class in high school, the process is crazy and sadly is commonly found in lakes across America. I sorta recommend this game to the casual players who love otters.  The otters are cute and real. RESPECT THE OTTERS
Interesting little time killer, proof of concept type game.   Don't expect to spend hours on it, but for a freeby, what can I say?

Magnificent! Among Ripples could be one of best educational games No need to explain your kids about complicate ecosystem  Just tell your kids short instructions how to play and then, let them explore
